cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 305 mi SSE of the western tip of Cuba and 300 mi SE of Cozumel, Mexico

motion.speed: 0 mph (expected to increase to ~10-12 mph NW in next 24 h)

cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to move northwest across the northwest Caribbean, cross or skirt the northern Yucatán late Monday, enter the southern-central Gulf of Mexico Tuesday, then accelerate north-northeast and make U.S. Gulf Coast landfall Wednesday before curving inland over the Southeast toward the Mid-Atlantic late week.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: U.S. central Gulf Coast (likely southeast Louisiana / Mississippi coast)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch/Warning confined to Yucatán Peninsula (Tulum to Río Lagartos) and Tropical-Storm Warning for Pinar del Río, Cuba.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Same as above – no U.S. Atlantic coast warnings in effect.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from Louisiana eastward to the western Florida Panhandle; inland path across Mississippi, Alabama, Tennessee, and the southern Appalachians.
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: None listed (no Mid-Atlantic stations in table)
weather_observation.wind: No significant tropical-storm-force winds expected at Wilmington, DE under the current forecast.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None – system forecast to be inland and weakened before reaching Mid-Atlantic coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: Remnant moisture could bring 1–2 inches of rain to the northern Mid-Atlantic on 30 Oct, but flooding risk is low.
